a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Major hurricanes are defined as those of category 3, 4 or 5 on the Saffirâ€“Simpson hurricane wind scale (SSHWS).
The SSHWS classifies storms based on the intensity of sustained winds. Major hurricanes have potential for
significant loss of life and damage.
Note: NOAA notes that because of the sparseness of towns and cities before 1900 in some coastal locations along the United States,
the data prior to 1900 may not be complete for all US states.
